roleset.name: to preserve, economize
roleset.note: CONSERVE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'conserve' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from conserve.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: transitive
example.text: In the past , [the socialist policies of the government]-1 strictly limited the size of new steel mills , petrochemical plants , car factories and other industrial concerns [*]-1 to conserve resources and restrict the profits [0] businessmen could make [*T*-1] .

roleset.name: politically leaning towards conservative
roleset.note: CONSERVATIVE-J NOTES: Added by Julia in refiling conserve/con.

role.descr: domain in which arg1 is conservative
the whole group, of which one faction is conservative

example.name: conservative-j
example.text: unlike movie actors who often burst on the scene with publicity and flagrant salaries, I was financially conservative.
example.arg: unlike movie actors who often burst on the scene with publicity and flagrant salaries

roleset.name: trick into doing something
roleset.note: CON-V NOTES: Frames file for 'con' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 10.6, Framenet entry Suasion4. (from con.03-v predicate notes)

role.descr: ill-gotten booty; what one was conned out of

example.name: induced action
example.text: Mary conned John into giving her all his desserts for the next month.
example.arg: into giving her all his desserts for the next month

example.name: the one example
example.text: ``So, [*]-1 don't come and try [*-1]to con us with a howdy y'all or a cowboy hat.''
example.arg: with a howdy y'all or a cowboy hat

example.name: that's hardly fair
example.text: Mary conned John out of all his desserts for the next month.
example.arg: out of all his desserts for the next month
